messages.subject: Fwd: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Shout it to the world!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Christina, I have no clue! I guess she thinks I am not capable of teaching my daughter. She didn t take the time to actually teach my sister, she went
messages.messageBody:
>
>In a message dated 6/2/99 11:02:14 PM PST, tbone2@... writes:
>
><< My mother is having a fit about me hsing my
> 5 year old daughter. I don't see how she can do that, when she homeschooled

> my little sister who just graduated at the WHO ceremony on May 23rd. >>
>
>Tanya,
>If you dont mind me asking....how does she explain her reasoning that she

>homeschooled your sister but you can't homeschool your daughter?
>Christina , also in WA

Christina,

I have no clue! I guess she thinks I am not capable of 'teaching' my daughter.
She didn't take the time to actually 'teach' my sister, she went through WHO,
and had a certified woman give her assignments, etc.
I'm not sure if I explained this earlier, but nothing I do is good enough for
my family. My husband and I had a rocky first 4 years. Now that we are "fully"
back together, they cannot accept that. Just to give you a clue how bad my Dad
is, we had a surprise party for my husband last month, my Dad sat in the car
the whole time, while my mother and sister came in to wish him a happy birthday!
Sweet, huh?! Anyways, I'm done babbling.
Tanya
Tanya in WA (state)



---SENT FROM A FREE INTERNET AND EMAIL ACCOUNT FROM WWW.FREEi.NET!---
